intro: Seseli libanotis f. ugoense, commonly known as the Ugoese Seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and small, clustered umbels of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils, often in mountainous regions. Its leaves are pinnately divided, with a serrated margin, and it is native to the Mediterranean region. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
